title: Name That Distribution!
question_text:
The dotplot below shows fifty values of a specific variable.
Which of the following is most likely the variable being displayed?

choices.text: The SAT test scores for fifty randomly selected 17-year-olds.
The purchase price of fifty cars owned by randomly selected office workers.
The shoe sizes of a group of fifty female teachers.
The heights of fifty 16-year-old girls in a choir.
The number of laps around a track that a child can run without stopping for twenty-five 8-year-olds and twenty-five 15-year-olds.

solution:
Since the dotplot displays a bimodal distribution, the situation being displayed most likely is made of two subgroups.

Choice 'E' would likely be bimodal because typical 8-year-olds would be able to run a lower number of laps than typical 15-year-olds. We would expect to see two different subgroups, which we see with the bimodal distribution.

Explanation of Distractors

Choice 'A' would likely have a unimodal and symmetric distribution.

Choice 'B' would likely have a unimodal and skewed right distribution. There would be many less expensive cars and a few more expensive cars.

Choice 'C' would likely have a unimodal and symmetric distribution.

Choice 'D' would likely have a unimodal and symmetric distribution.
